medical_history.chief_complaint: HIV-associated lipodystrophy, including fat loss in cheeks and fat gain in neck, chest, and abdomen.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after starting antiretroviral therapy with indinavir, leading to observable fat retention and changes in body morphology over the years. The patient self-discontinued medications in 2003 due to severe anemia and peripheral neuropathy caused by previous treatments, with noticeable body changes worsening over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosis of HIV in 1994; history of severe anemia while taking zidovudine; peripheral neuropathy from didanosine and stavudine; methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus finger abscess; oral herpes simplex; molluscum contagiosum; common warts; allergic rhinitis; acute pyelonephritis; positive tuberculosis skin test with isoniazid prophylaxis; hepatitis A and B infections.
medical_history.family_history: Father and paternal grandfather with hyperlipidemia and coronary artery disease.
medical_history.social_history: Smokes a quarter-pack of cigarettes per day, consumes 3 to 4 alcoholic drinks per week, has no history of drug use, and follows a mainly vegetarian diet.
